title: Neonatal and Paediatric Sonography | Singapore Institute of Technology

meta.description: This workshop provides advanced theoretical knowledge and practical skills for sonographers in paediatric and neonatal ultrasound, including imaging techniques and diagnostic processes.

text_lines: Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
This workshop provides advanced theoretical knowledge and practical skills for sonographers in paediatric and neonatal ultrasound, including imaging techniques and diagnostic processes.

This workshop is designed to provide the advanced theoretical knowledge and skills to support and complement the practical training required to produce a competent sonographer in paediatric and neonatal ultrasound.

It also aims to develop an understanding of the role of ultrasound in response to clinical requests and its influence on patient management. The workshop further aims to enable the exploration of the role of ultrasound in comparison to other imaging techniques and investigative procedures that may be required to assist the diagnostic process.

Hybrid instruction mode will be employed which combines didactic classroom teaching sessions with facilitated case-based learning, online learning activities and practical demonstration. You will be guided in the competent production, interpretation and assessment of the paediatric and neonatal ultrasound images.

You will develop and enhance your theoretical knowledge and advanced image interpretation as well as specialist scanning skills in sonography of the paediatric and neonatal population. Topics will include principles in neonatal and paediatric ultrasound scans, common indications, protocol and scanning technique of the infant/paediatric brain, neck, hip, spine, abdomen, kidney and bowel.
Healthcare professionals involved in ultrasound work

Participants are required to have a healthcare-related qualification. Prior clinical experience and knowledge of the general operation of ultrasound machines may be given preferential consideration​​​​​​
Discuss the common indications for neonatal and paediatrics imaging requests
Understand the basic principles and technical requirements of neonatal and paediatric ultrasound imaging
Understand the criteria for diagnostic quality images
Recognise modifications to routine scanning approaches and limitations in regards to imaging of neonates and paediatrics
Recognise the normal and abnormal imaging characteristics of the neonatal and paediatric ultrasound scans
Associate Professor, Health and Social Sciences, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor, Health and Social Sciences, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Ooi specialises in ultrasound modality since 2001. She graduated with a Diploma in Diagnostic Radiography from Nanyang Polytechnic in 1998, Bachelor of Applied Science (Medical Imaging) in 2000 from Charles Sturt University, Australia and Master in Medical Sonography in 2008 from Monash University, Australia. She has completed her PhD in Medical Imaging at Monash University. Her research area focuses on the application of advanced ultrasound imaging technique, namely ultrasound elastography, in the diagnosis and treatment monitoring of musculotendinous problems. Her current research investigates the role of ultrasound elastography in early diagnosis of liver fibrosis and portal hypertension in patients suffering from chronic liver disease. She has received a number of competitive research grants, including the SingHealth Foundation and SGH Research Grant. Dr. Ooi is currently holding Joint Appointment at Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT) and was adjunct faculty at Nanyang Polytechnic. She is involved in teaching and training of junior radiographers, medical students and residents.  She is currently the PGAHI (Post Graduate Allied Health Institute) faculty trainer and workshop instructor. She presents regularly at local and international conferences and seminars.
Principal Radiographer, Department of Diagnostic and Interventional Imaging, KK Women’s and Children’s Hospital
Principal Radiographer, Department of Diagnostic and Interventional Imaging, KK Women’s and Children’s Hospital

Eunice has been practising ultrasound since 2006. Eunice obtained her Diploma in Diagnostic Radiography from Nanyang Polytechnic in 2005. She graduated from University of Sydney, Australia in 2008 and was awarded her Bachelor Degree in Medial Radiation Technology (MRT).
Eunice is one of the trainers for KK’s DDII paediatric ultrasound team. She has also participated in lectures and workshops organised for sonographers in Singapore.
Senior Radiographer, Department of Diagnostic and Interventional Imaging,  KK Women’s and Children’s Hospital
Senior Radiographer, Department of Diagnostic and Interventional Imaging,  KK Women’s and Children’s Hospital

Joycelyn is a senior radiographer who has been practising in the field of sonography since 2009. Joycelyn obtained her Diploma in Diagnostic Radiography from Nanyang Polytechnic in 2007, as well as a Bachelor Degree in Applied Science (MRS) Diagnostic Radiography from the University of Sydney, Australia in 2008. She also obtained a Master of Medical Ultrasound from Monash University, Australia in 2014. Joycelyn is currently part of the team involved in the training of new sonographers and is also involved in a quality control program for ultrasound scans in KK hospital. She has also previously participated in organizing workshops for sonographers from various hospitals in Singapore.
Senior Principal Radiographer, KK Women’s and Children’s Hospital
Senior Principal Radiographer, KK Women’s and Children’s Hospital

Possessing a strong foundation in medical imaging, Wong Lee holds a Master’s degree in Medical Ultrasound from Monash University in 2014, a Bachelor of Medical Radiation Science (Medical Imaging) from Charles Sturt University, and a Diploma in Diagnostic Radiography from Nanyang Polytechnic. Her dedication to the field ensures the delivery of accurate and insightful ultrasound examinations. She is involved in teaching and training of junior radiographers and sonographers.
Principal Radiographer, KK Women's and Children's Hospital
Principal Radiographer, KK Women's and Children's Hospital
Lay Ee is currently a principal radiographer at KK Women's and Children's Hospital. She has been practicing ultrasound since 2011 and specialises in adult and paediatric ultrasound.

Lay Ee obtained her Diploma in Diagnostic Radiography from Nanyang Polytechnic in 2008, Bachelor's Degree in Applied Science (MRS) Diagnostic Radiography Honours (First class) from the University of Sydney, Australia in 2010 and Master of Medical Ultrasound from Monash University, Australia in 2021.

Lay Ee has a keen interest in research and actively participates in radiology-related scientific research and quality improvement projects. Aside from that, she is also a clinical educator and trainer involved in teaching, training and ensuring quality of scans for junior radiographers, sonographers and residents.
Core principles of Neonatal and Paediatric Sonography
Instrumentation, system presets and technical requirements
Core principles in Neonatal Brain Ultrasound
Core principles in Neonatal Hip Ultrasound
Normal gross and sonographic anatomy, equipment/techniques/protocol, clinical presentation, common indications, ultrasound detectable pathologies
Upper Abdominal Ultrasound in Neonates, Infants and Children
Practical demo / hands-on using FAST model
A Certificate of Attainment will be issued to participants who
Attend at least 75% of the course; and
Undertake and pass non-credit bearing assessment during the course
Participants who meet the attendance requirement but do not pass the assessment will receive a Certificate of Participation.
The full fee for this course is S$4,185.60.
All fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.
Learn more about funding schemes available
SIT Punggol Campus, 1 Punggol Coast Road, Singapore 828608
Improving Patient Outcomes through Advanced Clinical Supervision Competency

The Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT) taps on evidence-based education practices to address the increasing demand for advanced clinical supervision competencies among Allied Health Professionals and improve patient outcomes.
Health Sciences, Adult and Geriatric Rehabilitation, Competency-based Education
Shedding Light on Workplace Safety in Social Services
These niche courses equip professionals in social service agencies with the skills to optimise health and safety at the workplace.
Health Sciences, Social Sciences, Workplace Safety and Health
Armed with a Postgraduate Diploma in Sonography, Florence Tan is ready for advanced clinical practice and leadership.
Redefining Thinking and Learning at SkillsFuture Festival

The annual SkillsFuture Festival to promote lifelong learning was hosted by the Singapore University of Technology and Design (SUTD) this year on 23 July. Riding on the theme of ‘Design for the Future Economy’, the single-day event featured 53 learning workshops and talks, with SIT faculty staff sharing their expert insights on thinking and learning.
Design Innovation, Leadership and Communication, Health Sciences
With the ageing population in Singapore, there has been a paradigm shift from structured institutionalised care to a more person-centric approach.
Health Sciences, Adult and Geriatric Rehabilitation, Design Innovation
As Singapore's ageing population continues to grow, care for the elderly is becoming a pressing issue.
Health Sciences, Adult and Geriatric Rehabilitation
This intensive workshop provides theoretical and practical skills in small parts ultrasound, including scrotal, penile, thyroid, parathyroid, salivary glands, and lymph nodes.

This intensive workshop provides theoretical and practical skills in breast ultrasound and imaging of lumps and bumps, including intervention work, advanced imaging techniques, and interpretation of abnormal findings.
Interprofessional Low Vision Rehabilitation: Basic Foundations
This course equips healthcare professionals to manage low vision patients, develop assessment skills, support psychosocial adjustment and more.
Occupational Therapy, Physiotherapy, Nursing, Health Sciences
This course is designed to equip AHP clinical supervisors and educators with the skills to provide effective clinical training to AHPs and students.
Adult and Geriatric Rehabilitation, Health Sciences
This course equips occupational therapists with skills in occupational therapy-centric cognitive-perceptual assessments, problem identification, goal setting, and intervention plans.
Health Sciences, Adult and Geriatric Rehabilitation, Occupational Therapy
This course is a collaboration with Tan Tock Seng Hospital. It aims to equip participants with core competencies of RTWCs to assess and facilitate the early RTW of ill or injured workers.
